prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
On the day of the crime, Iris the defendent, Bikini the witness, Phoenix the protagonist, Elise the victim, and everyone else were having dinner together at the Hazakura Temple. After dinner, Iris gave her hood to Phoenix as a gift. The witness Bikini is describing what she did after that.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Click here for details.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. She is wearing a white robe and a hood. She was holding a book and a staff. The staff has a crystal sphere attached to it.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. There is no crystal sphere attached. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. A seven-branched, jagged sword. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. [caption] One track is shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. Click here for details.
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night I was helping an acolyte with her training in the Inner Temple. But...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well, as you can see, my back likes to act up. Violently.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I left Iris to help the acolyte, and returned to Hazakura Temple.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: There's no bath at the Inner Temple, you see, and I needed a long, hot soak.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was after I had finished, just as I was heading back... that's when I saw it!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The key is to cross-reference Bikini's testimonies with the evidence to find a contradiction.

Looking at Bikini's testimonies:

Testimony 3: She says Iris came to the Inner Temple dressed exactly as she had been at dinner. But from the evidence, we know that Iris gave her hood to Phoenix before the crime (Evidence 6: Iris's Hood). If Iris gave away her hood, she wouldn't be wearing it anymore. So if Bikini saw Iris with the hood on, that contradicts because Iris shouldn't have it. Therefore, Testimony 3 (Iris was dressed the same) conflicts with Evidence 6 (Iris's Hood was given away). That's the contradiction.

{"evidence": 6, "testimony": 3}

Testimony 2

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So the task is to find one pair where the evidence provided doesn't match what's said in the testimony.

First, I need to look through the testimonies given by Bikini. Let's list them out:

Testimony 0: She finished her bath around 11 and was returning to Inner Temple.
Testimony 1: Heard a noise from the courtyard and looked.
Testimony 2: Saw Iris with the sword, implicating her.
Testimony 3: Iris wasn't wearing her hood.
Testimony 4: Elise was in the corner room facing the courtyard.
Testimony 5: The stabbing happened after Elise was pushed out the window.

Now, the evidence list is quite extensive. Let me go through each evidence to see if any directly contradicts these statements.

Looking at Testimony 3: Bikini mentions that Iris didn't have her hood on. But Evidence 6 is Iris's Hood, which says that the hood was received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. The lights out bell was at 10 PM according to Iris's Testimony (Evidence 12). If Iris gave her hood to someone before 10 PM, she wouldn't have it when the crime happened after 10 PM. However, Bikini says she saw Iris without the hood during the crime, which would align if the hood was already given away. Wait, maybe there's a contradiction here. Let me check again.

Wait, Evidence 6 says that Iris's Hood was received before the lights out bell (which was at 10 PM). So Iris wasn't wearing the hood after 10 PM. Testimony 3 says that during the crime (which occurred between 10-11 PM), Iris wasn't wearing her hood. That actually matches. So maybe that's not the contradiction.

Let's check another testimony. Testimony 5 says the stabbing occurred after Elise was pushed out the window. The autopsy report (Evidence 11) states the cause was a stab in the back, and the body fell 10 ft after death. So if she was stabbed before being pushed out, but Bikini's testimony says the stabbing happened after being pushed. That seems contradictory. Wait, the autopsy report says the body fell after death, meaning she was already dead when she fell. So if she was stabbed (which caused death) and then fell, that would mean the stabbing happened before the fall. But Bikini's Testimony 5 says the stabbing was after she was pushed out (the fall). That would be a contradiction. So Evidence 11 (autopsy report) contradicts Testimony 5. That's a possible pair.

Another possible contradiction: Testimony 2 says Bikini saw Iris with the sword (Shichishito, Evidence 10). But Evidence 10 says the Shichishito had the victim's blood and suspect's fingerprints but is not the actual murder weapon. The real weapon is the Victim's Staff (Evidence 9), which had a hidden sword. So if Bikini saw Iris with the Shichishito, but that's not the actual murder weapon, that might be a contradiction. However, maybe the staff's hidden sword was the real weapon, so the testimony about the Shichishito is misleading but not directly contradicting. The staff's sword is the actual weapon, so if Bikini saw the Shichishito, perhaps she's mistaken. But I'm not sure if that's a direct contradiction.

Alternatively, Testimony 5 (stabbing after being pushed) vs. Autopsy Report (stab caused death, then fell). The autopsy says the stab caused death, then the body fell, so the stabbing was before the fall. But Bikini's testimony says the stabbing happened after she was pushed (fell). So that's a direct contradiction. So Evidence 11 (autopsy report) contradicts Testimony 5. That seems solid.

Another angle: Testimony 4 says Elise was in the corner room facing the courtyard. The photo of Elise (Evidence 5) shows her in a white robe and hood, holding a staff with a crystal sphere. But the hanging scroll (Evidence 4) has Misty Fey's image obscured by gravy. Not sure how that connects.

Looking at the Weather Data (Evidence 7): Snow from 7-10:50 PM, lightning from 10-11 PM. Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45. The fire started and went out in 30 minutes. If Bikini finished her bath around 11 (Testimony 0), but the snow stopped at 10:50 PM, then when she walked back, there might be snow tracks. The Tracks Photo (Evidence 14) shows one track leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. But I'm not sure how this contradicts testimony.

Back to the autopsy report vs Testimony 5: The autopsy clearly states the victim was stabbed, died, then fell 10ft. So the sequence is stab -> death -> fall. Bikini's Testimony 5 says the stabbing happened after the fall. So if she was already dead when she fell, the stabbing couldn't have occurred after. Therefore, the autopsy report contradicts Testimony 5. That's a solid contradiction.

So the answer should be Evidence 11 (Elise's Autopsy Report) and Testimony 5.

{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 5}

Okay, let's tackle this. So, the user wants to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. They specified only one pair, and the answer has to be in JSON at the end. 

First, I need to go through the testimonies provided by Bikini. The key here is to check each testimony against the evidence to find a contradiction.

Wait, but the Tracks Photo (Evidence 14) says "one track is shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge." So if someone used the snowmobile to go to the bridge, there's a track going there. But if they came back, there should be another track. But the photo only shows one track. That suggests that the snowmobile wasn't returned, which contradicts the idea that the perpetrator came back, as Bikini suggests in Testimony 4 ("came back while I was knocked out"). If they came back, there should be tracks both ways, but the photo only shows one. So the contradiction would be between Testimony 4 and Evidence 14. But Testimony 4 is Bikini speculating that the killer came back, but the tracks only show one way. Alternatively, Testimony 2 says she saw tracks indicating the snowmobile was used. The photo shows a single track, but using the snowmobile would create tracks both ways if someone went and returned. Therefore, the existence of only one track in Evidence 14 contradicts Testimony 2, which implies the snowmobile was used (which should have two tracks if they went and came back). Wait, but maybe the snowmobile was used only one way. For example, someone took it to the bridge and left it there. Then the tracks would only be one way. But Bikini's Testimony 3 says it takes 5 minutes by snowmobile. So if someone went to the bridge, dumped the weapon, and came back, they would need to use the snowmobile both ways, creating two tracks. But the photo shows only one track. Therefore, Testimony 4 (where Bikini suggests they came back) contradicts Evidence 14 (only one track). But Testimony 2 is her saying she saw the tracks indicating the snowmobile was used. If the snowmobile was used to go to the bridge and come back, there should be two tracks, but the photo shows only one. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 14. Alternatively, Testimony 3 (time taken) might not directly contradict, but the key is the number of tracks. So the correct pair would be Evidence 14 (Tracks Photo) and Testimony 2 (snowmobile tracks indicating use). The photo shows only one track, implying the snowmobile was used once (either to go or come), but Testimony 2 says the tracks indicate it was used, which would require two tracks if they went and came back. But maybe the contradiction is that Bikini saw tracks indicating the snowmobile was used, but the photo shows only one track, which suggests it was used only once. Therefore, the testimony and evidence contradict each other. But I need to confirm the exact details. Let me check the exact wording. Evidence 14: "One track is shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge." So only one track. Testimony 2: "I saw tracks! Tracks that indicated the snowmobile had been used!"
